message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on lysosomal storage disorders for help. Hunter syndrome is caused by a deficiency of iduronate sulfatase, which leads to an accumulation of complex carbohydrates known as mucopolysaccharides. Fabry disease, which is caused by a deficiency of alpha-galactosidase A, also leads to the accumulation of complex carbohydrates. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) alpha-galactosidase A.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Hunter syndrome is caused by a deficiency of iduronate sulfatase, which breaks down glycosaminoglycans. Among the options, only Fabry disease, which is caused by a deficiency of alpha-galactosidase A, has a similar inheritance pattern as Hunter syndrome. The other options are associated with different lysosomal storage diseases.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Hunter syndrome is autosomal recessive and results from a deficiency in iduronate sulfatase. Among the options, only alpha-galactosidase A deficiency causes a pattern similar to Hunter syndrome, which is known as Fabry disease.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. This is a question about the inheritance pattern of a lysosomal enzyme deficiency that is similar to Hunter syndrome, which is inherited in an X-linked recessive pattern. Among the options, only alpha-galactosidase A deficiency (Fabry disease) is also inherited in an X-linked recessive pattern.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on lysosomal storage disorders for help. Hunter syndrome is caused by a deficiency of iduronate sulfatase, which is involved in the degradation of glycosaminoglycans. Among the options, only a deficiency of alpha-galactosidase A is inherited in a pattern similar to Hunter syndrome, as it causes Fabry disease, which is also a lysosomal storage disorder involving glycosphingolipid accumulation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Hunter syndrome is caused by a deficiency of iduronate sulfatase, which leads to accumulation of glycosaminoglycans. Among the options, only alpha-galactosidase A deficiency causes a similar pattern of lysosomal storage disease, known as Fabry disease.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Hunter syndrome is caused by a deficiency of iduronate sulfatase, which is inherited in an X-linked recessive pattern. Among the options, only Fabry disease, caused by a deficiency in alpha-galactosidase A, is also inherited in an X-linked recessive pattern. Therefore, the correct answer is (B).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Hunter syndrome is caused by a deficiency of iduronate sulfatase and is inherited in an X-linked recessive pattern. Fabry disease, which is caused by a deficiency of alpha-galactosidase A, is also inherited in an X-linked recessive pattern, similar to Hunter syndrome. Therefore, the answer is (B) alpha-galactosidase A.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Hunter syndrome is an X-linked recessive disorder that results in a deficiency of iduronate sulfatase. Fabry disease is another X-linked, lysosomal storage disorder caused by an alpha-galactosidase A deficiency, making option (B) the correct answer.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Hunter Syndrome is an X-linked recessive disorder caused by a deficiency of the enzyme iduronate sulfatase. Among the options, only Alpha-galactosidase A deficiency is inherited in an X-linked recessive pattern, similar to Hunter syndrome. Sphingomyelinase deficiency causes Niemann-Pick disease, Galactocerebrosidase deficiency causes Krabbe disease, and Alpha-L-iduronidase deficiency causes Hurler syndrome.
